column5: I believe blue light was under $30 US funds in bottles. And Kokanee was around $36 US funds.
Mmmm. Kokanee.... Heaven in a can....
Leaving tomorrow for Pakwash and was curious what the cost of a case of beer is? Anything along the lines of Blue Light would give me a ball park. Any recent travelers? Thanks.
Beer is pricy up North! You can bring one case per adult with you without paying a duty.
I am aware of that but I am going to grab some to take home and was just curious what the prices are.
Plan on about $2 cdn per beer up here.

As a starting point, double the cost of what you would normally pay in the states. For a case of Blue I'm guessing you'll pay $40 -45 CDN. I'm not sure if the Beer Store publishes prices or not, but it may worth a search. PjShorthorn
Check out www.thebeerstore.ca for the latest prices, choices and sales.
Pick it up at the Canadian duty free store on the way home. Pretty sure I paid $20 U.S. coming home May 23.
At the 'Beer Store' 24 cans of Molson's about $36 Canadian funds
If you are planning on bringing some home hit the duty free shop, and grab a case of Kokanee and a liter of Weisers for me. MMMMMMM!
u r on holidays. who gives a turkey on the price of beer!
